warnings: Potential missing topics due to incomplete extraction

tiers.foundation_content: Content is split into six teaching topics C1-C6 and a practical activity skills topic C7. Paper 1 assesses content from Topics C1–C3 and C7. Paper 2 assesses content from Topics C4–C6 and C7, with assumed knowledge of Topics C1–C3.
tiers.higher_content: Content is split into six teaching topics C1-C6 and a practical activity skills topic C7. Paper 3 assesses content from Topics C1–C3 and C7. Paper 4 assesses content from Topics C4–C6 and C7, with assumed knowledge of Topics C1–C3.
differences: Foundation Tier covers grades 5 to 1, while Higher Tier covers grades 9 to 4.
Higher Tier includes additional content indicated in bold type.

main_sections: Topic C2: Elements, compounds and mixtures
Topic C4: Predicting and identifying reactions and products
Topic C5: Monitoring and controlling chemical reactions
content_overview.organization: Content is organized into topics with sub-topics, each with summaries, common misconceptions, and tiering information.

analysis.extraction_guidance: Focus on extracting topic-based content with sub-topics, summaries, and tiering information. Ensure to capture the differences between Foundation and Higher tiers.
